snippet: Hundreds of Balkan entrepreneurs have launched tech start-ups that they hope to take global, transforming a formerly communist region into a hub for innovation.
abstract: Hundreds of Balkan entrepreneurs have begun tech start-ups, turning poor, formerly communist part of Europe into center for Internet-based innovation; obstacles to taking their businesses global, however, include competition from other European start-up destinations, lack of government incentives and little business experience.
lead_paragraph: Hundreds of Balkan entrepreneurs have launched tech start-ups that they hope to take global, transforming a formerly communist region into a hub for innovation.

headline.main: Nurturing Start-Up Culture in the Lower-Cost Balkans
headline.print_headline: Nurturing Start-Up Culture in the Lower-Cost Balkans
